sub_title: Inspired by action, acting to inspire
summary:
A 21-year-old social activist working on climate change, sustainability, and civil society empowerment. A student of Political Science and International Relations. 

Founder-President of the Open Dialogues International Foundation.

UNFCCC climate negotiator specialized in Action for Climate Empowerment (ACE) and Just Transition.

Experienced in project management, team leadership, advocacy, NGOs, public campaigning and awareness raising, climate diplomacy, United Nations, multilateral environmental agreements. Eager to work in diverse groups and international settings.

I believe in cooperation, dialogue, and exchanging ideas with amazing people!
Will you join me and become my next inspiration?

certifications.name: An Introduction to Climate Change and Human Rights
Youthpass: Strategic partnerships in the youth field

projects.title: Open Dialogues on Climate Change
projects.description:
The aim of the Open Dialogues on Climate Change (ODCC) is organizing inclusive dialogues with relevant stakeholders concerning the climate crisis. The project brings together the voices of different social groups, allowing them to meet, engage in a conversation, and create proposals of specific solutions and system changes which we aim to implement in real life.

As part of the first edition of ODCC, more than 200 people joined our team and Open Dialogues happened in 10 countries on 3 continents. We summarized the outcomes and presented our international recommendations during an official side event at the COP26 UN Climate Change Conference in Glasgow, titled "Raise your voice, join the conversation! Open Dialogues on Climate Change".

As the Founder of the project, I also serve as the main International Coordinator, and a National Coordinator for Poland. I am responsible for coordinating the implementation of the project around the world, supervising a diverse international team of volunteers, partnerships, media relations, as well as policy and advocacy coordination.

contributors.headline: Inspired by action, acting to inspire

projects.title: Youth Climate Strike Katowice
projects.description:
Youth Climate Strike Katowice (Młodzieżowy Strajk Klimatyczny Katowice) is a group of young people who demand climate action from the politicians. We are part of the global Fridays For Future movement initiated by Greta Thunberg. We act on a local level, as well as on a national level in cooperation with the national Youth Climate Strike movement.

Our actions include protests and demonstrations (e. g. Holiday Climate Strike), as well as meetings, workshops and awareness-raising activities.

projects.title: Model United Nations

3. The British School Warsaw Model United Nations (Warsaw, Poland) - President, United Nations Security Council, Best Chair Award

profile_positions.description:
Raise your voice, join the conversation! Everyone matters in an Open Dialogue!

The Open Dialogues International Foundation works every day to create a more open, equal, and sustainable world. It is an international NGO registered in the Republic of Poland. It is dedicated to the values of dialogue, cooperation, sustainable development, democracy, and equality for all. 

The Foundation organizes various educational activities and awareness-raising campaigns, supports grassroots initiatives, as well as engages in local, national, and global advocacy to represent the voices of marginalized groups. It also coordinates the Open Dialogues on Climate Change - a worldwide series of multi-stakeholder dialogues on the climate crisis, aimed at proposing specific solutions and implementing them.

I am the official Founder of the organization, as well as its President of the Board.
profile_positions.title: Founder

profile_positions.description:
Negotiator for the Republic of Liberia in the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC) international multilateral negotiations process.

Topics of expertise: Action for Climate Empowerment (ACE), Just Transition, Just Transition Work Programme (JTWP).

Appointed in October 2022 to become a member of Liberia's negotiating team for the UNFCCC COP27 (2022 United Nations Climate Change Conference). At this session, I successfully negotiated the Action Plan under the Glasgow work programme on Action for Climate Empowerment, which has been adopted by the COP27, the CMA4, and the SBI57. 

My cooperation with the delegation continued at the next negotiating session, the 2023 Bonn Climate Change Conference - the 58th meeting of the UNFCCC Subsidiary Bodies (SB58). At this session I was the only person representing Liberia in the first-ever negotiations of the Just Transition Work Programme (JTWP). The session successfully finished with the SBI58 and SBSTA58 adopting a conclusion document and an informal note, containing possible elements of the Work Programme, including those provided by me on behalf of the delegation.

The offer has already been extended to the next negotiating session, COP28 in Dubai.

My responsibilities include:
- Providing text proposals and substantive ideas to be included in decisions
- Formal and informal interventions on behalf of Liberia during negotiating sessions, including both oral statements and written submissions
- Regular coordination with relevant negotiating groups and consultation with relevant constituencies
- Representing the national position of Liberia and ensuring sufficient consideration of Liberia's interests, while also including the perspective of youth and civil society
- Reacting to changes in group dynamics and negotiating compromised versions of the text
- Reporting to the Liberian delegation on the proceedings
profile_positions.title: Climate Negotiator

profile_positions.description:
I have represented youth and civil society in the UNFCCC negotiations process. My main topics of interest have been Action for Climate Empowerment (ACE), adaptation, capacity building, just transition.

I have participated in the following UNFCCC sessions:

1. COP24 
- Representing Poland (youth delegate)
- Participant of a side event “No climate for the young generation”

2. AC15 and AC16 (15th and 16th meetings of the Adaptation Committee)
- Representing Youth NGOs

3. PCCB 3 and PCCB 5 (3rd and 5th meetings of the Paris Committee on Capacity Building)
- Representing Youth NGOs

4. SB50 
- Representing Children and Youth International
- Co-authored an article for the “youth takeover” of the NGO daily newsletter
- Intervened during a briefing with the High Level Champions and an Open-Ended Dialogue with the COP25 Presidency

5. COP25 
- Head of Delegation of the Polish Ecological Club
- Involved in wide consultations with the Polish youth 
- Speaker at the Youth and Future Generations Day opening ceremony and at the Climate Action Studio
- Delivered the closing plenary statement on behalf of Youth NGOs

6. Virtual SB2021 
- Representing the Polish Ecological Club
- YOUNGO delegate to negotiations on matters relating to Capacity Building and on Transparency (methodological issues under the Paris Agreement)

7. COP26 
- An official Polish youth delegate
- Intervened during negotiating sessions on Action for Climate Empowerment, involved in successful lobbying efforts on the Glasgow Work Programme on ACE
- Led the organization of an official COP26 side event titled "Raise your voice, join the conversation! Open Dialogues on Climate Change"

8. SB56
- An official Polish youth delegate
- Speaker at the ACE technical workshop, rapporteur at the first ACE Dialogue
- Involved in ACE negotiations, led and coordinated the engagement of YOUNGO ACE Working Group in the session
profile_positions.title: Youth/NGO Representative

profile_positions.description:
European Climate Pact Ambassador since February 2022. 

Member of the European Climate Pact Youth Dialogues working group. Participant of the first Youth Dialogue with EVP Frans Timmermans on sustainable consumption and production in Brussels. Stakeholder of the European Year of Youth co-creation process. Participant of European Climate Pact Ambassadors meetings during the COP27.

The European Climate Pact is a movement of people united around a common cause, each taking steps to build a more sustainable Europe for us all. Launched by the European Commission, the Climate Pact is part of the European Green Deal and is helping the EU to meet its goal to be the first climate-neutral continent in the world by 2050.
profile_positions.title: European Climate Pact Ambassador

profile_positions.description:
"We are the first generation to feel the sting of climate change, and we are the last generation that can do something about it."​ - Jay Inslee 

LCOY Poland has been created with purpose to gather young people from Poland and abroad & give them a unique opportunity to meet, talk and broaden their knowledge about the climate crisis. We want stress the urgent need for establishing specific ideas and solutions to what is currently happening. Conversation is important, but it is the action we strive for. 

Our mission is youth empowerment, capacity-building and raising awareness. Our goal is bringing the whole youth climate movement together and encouraging its members to work towards a better world. 

Local Youth Conference Poland operates as a part of the UNFCCC Youth Constituency (YOUNGO). 

I was the Head Organizer of LCOY Poland 2019 (Katowice, Poland) and LCOY Poland 2021 (online). I have been responsible for coordinating the organizing team, fundraising, partnerships, communication with speakers and participants, and running the social media of LCOY Poland 2021.
profile_positions.title: Founder & Head Organizer

profile_positions.description:
In September 2022 I was selected to become one of the two YOUNGO's Action for Climate Empowerment (ACE) Working Group Contact Points.

My responsibilities included coordinating the Working Group's engagement in the UNFCCC process and other initiatives, serving as a contact person for new and potential members, facilitating weekly team meetings, communicating with the Constituency Focal Points and the UNFCCC Secretariat, collaborating with other Working Groups, and implementing partnerships with other stakeholders.

YOUNGO is the official Children and Youth Constituency of the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC).
profile_positions.title: ACE Contact Point

profile_positions.description: In August 2019 I was selected to become one of the Team Mentors - the people responsible for supervising and supporting projects and their creators during the 2019/2020 edition of the social project olympiad "Zwolnieni z Teorii".
profile_positions.title: Team Mentor

profile_positions.description:
Bielsko-Biała Model United Nations (BBMUN) is a United Nations simulation for high school and university students. Here, young people from all around Poland and abroad have a unique opportunity to take the role of delegates of different UN Member States. They have a chance to meet each other and debate upon the most important global issues, while developing their public speaking skills and enjoying the international atmosphere.

The first edition of Bielsko-Biała Model United Nations took place on June 15th-17th 2019 in the city of Bielsko-Biała. The event was organized by a group of 6 students in cooperation with Mikołaj Rej High School in Bielsko-Biała.

I had the pleasure of leading the organizing team as the Secretary-General.
profile_positions.title: Secretary-General

profile_positions.description:
Open Minds Project was created by 3 high school students who discovered a need to open people's minds. The project included organizing meetings for young people, where they received a chance to get together, talk, play a game or two and gain useful knowledge about psychology and mental health thanks to various lectures and workshops with psychologists. 

Open Minds Project team was active from December 2018 to March 2019. We organized 2 meetings in Bielsko-Biała and Katowice, as well as a few actions, during which we talked to people in the streets and schools about psychology and mental health. The project was officially finished in April 2019.
profile_positions.title: Project Coordinator

volunteer_experiences.description: Active member of the official Youth Constituency of the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC). Member of the 2019/2020 Bottomlining Team (BLT). Member of the Action for Climate Empowerment (ACE) Working Group.

volunteer_experiences.description: Active member of the Association. Member of the 2020/2021 Committee for Intellectual Activities (CIA). Organized various lectures on topics related to international politics. Hosted a lecture on women's rights in Poland in January 2021.

I represented Poland during the Mock COP26 initiative and contributed to the international statement of all delegates (the Mock COP26 Treaty).
Volunteer at Greenpeace Climate Hub in December 2018, during the 2018 United Nations Climate Change Conference in Katowice, Poland.
